div.p: Remember, you can always reach us at COVID19@columbuspreparatoryacademy.org.
Update April 9th at 6:03 PM – The Board unanimously approved the Virtual Learning Plan effective April 6th, 2020. Please click here for a copy of the approved plan.
Update March 30th at 3:30 PM – Please see this message posted by Mr. Moore following the press conference from Ohio Governor Mike DeWine.

“Today, Ohio Governor, Mike DeWine announced that Ohio schools will remain closed to students through May 1, 2020. Our School Board and administrative team continue to follow directives as they are laid out by the Governor, state health professionals, and local government leaders. We are strengthened in our knowledge that our CPA family is resilient and connected. We are proud to have parents and families prepared to offer help in any way they can.

Please know that as we receive updates from the Ohio Department of Education, CPA’s teachers and administrative team are prepared to use all available resources to meet and exceed all ODE expectations. We remain committed to doing all we can as a community to support the social, emotional and educational outputs of every CPA student.”
Update March 25th at 10:45 AM – Check out this great video from our amazing CPA Counselors by clicking this link.
Update March 20th at 6:40 PM – Please find a copy of Mr. Moore’s weekly newsletter by clicking here.
Update March 19th at 1:00 PM – This is a great video to watch as a youth and also adults. It is only a 10-minute video, we encourage you to share it. Click here to watch it.

Update March 18th at 3:30 PM – The CPA team has added a new website link for our CPA Family and Community. If we become aware of financial assistance that we think might be of benefit, then we will add it to this link.
Update March 17th at 3:30 PM – Please see a new resource from our CPA Counseling Team by clicking here.

Update March 14th at 8:35 PM – We have started to collect resource flyers from local businesses that are offering free or reduced breakfast or lunch meals to students K – 12. Please click here to view these resources. As we find more, we will add them to this site. Additionally, please click here to view a School Closure Parents Resource guide put together by our amazing CPA counselors.
Update March 13th at 4:16 PM – Please see the document by clicking here for free breakfast and lunch locations for all students under 18 years old being provided by Columbus City Schools.

Update March 13th at 11:30 AM – The PTO has created a special Paypal link for parents to use to turn in money for the candy bar sales. Please click here or visit our main website, click on resources and navigate to the last option “PTO Candy Bar Money” to be directed to the special Paypal link.
Update March 12th at 6:30 PM – Here is a link to the letter posted by the administration on Facebook
Update March 12th at 6:17 PM – Please click here to access our breakfast and lunch survey
